item.title: How to build a very simple forum with PHP, MYSQL,CSS,XAMPP
item.description: First of all welcome to my blog youmator, in this tutorial i will teach you how to build a very simple forum with php, for the sake of simplictiy we would completely ignore css for this tutorial. Requirements Before starting this tutorial these are the requirements that we need A web server with php installed ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
First of all welcome to my blog youmator, in this tutorial i will teach you how to build a very simple forum with php, for the sake of simplictiy we would completely ignore css for this tutorial.

Requirements

Before starting this tutorial these are the requirements that we need

  • A web server with php installed ( Probably apache or nginx )
  • A Mysql database
  • Sublime text or a text editor of your choice.

If you have all of the above installed you can skip to this section, or else read the installation manual

Installation Manual

This installation manual covers a list of operating systems to obtain the setup for the current tutorial. Currently we cover windows, mac, ubuntu and any other linux operating systems.

Windows XAMPP Installation

We have different setups based on the windows version.

For windows 7:

Follow the below video tutorial for installing xampp on windows 7

For windows 8 / 10 you can follow this awesome tutorial

Linux MYSQL and Apache installation

To install apache / nginx server and mysql database for linux we have a very detailed tutorial provided by digital ocean, but basically this should be the set of commands to install it on linux

sudo apt install apache2
sudo apt install mysql-server

you can also watch the below video tutorial if you missed something

Mac Server / Database installation

For mac you can use the below video

We are all set now, once you have installed and configured this, we need the following info before starting the tutorial.

  • Your database username
  • Your database password

We need the above to use your database from your server.

What we are going to build ?

For a forum i can think of two pages which we need to create, for the sake of simplicity lets completely ignore user authentication. Lets assume that this is an anonymous forum. So any one who visits the page can comment and participate in the discussion.So we would need the following two pages

  • A page to list all the forum questions and answers
  • A page to view a single forum question and answers

we name the pages to the following file names

  • Go to your html folder, create a folder named forum for our tutorial
  • Inside the folder create these two files

The folder structure should look like the below

we have created a folder structure for our project, now we can start to add the code. I am going to explain it line by line what each line of code is doing to get a clear idea. i can divide the functionalities in to the following sub tasks. we need code to

  • Create a basic database and table structure for forum.
  • Create a form to save the question.
  • Show all saved questions in the index.php
  • Allow user to add answer for a question.

Create a basic database and table structure for forum

Before creating a database connection you need to login to the mysql server. You can do this via phpmyadmin a GUI tool to access your mysql instance. First of all we need to create a database named forum

Step 1: Open phpmyadmin, click on the left side, and click on the icon.

Step 2: Set the database name as forum.

Step 3: Now we have a database ready, we need to create a table in the mysql, to create a table you need to execute a mysql query, you can execute the mysql query by clicking on this option.

The query you need to paste in this box is the below.

CREATE TABLE `forum`.`question` ( `id` INT(100) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT , `question` VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL , `answer` TEXT NOT NULL , PRIMARY KEY (`id`));

Click on the go button, if everything goes well we should have a table like this.

PHP, MYSQL are two different process at the operating system level, to communicate with one another PHP has a predefined function which can be used to connect to MYSQL database.

The function is 

mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database ...some other arguments)

so we need to provide $host, $username, $password, $database values in order to use this function

Note: If you didnt setup password for mysql you can pass null for $password variable

Lets try to establish a database connection, type the below code in index.php.

<?php

$host = 'localhost';

$username = 'phpmyadmin';

$password = 'some_pass';

$database = 'forum';

$database_connection = mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database);


if ( $database_connection === false ) {
	echo "Database connection failed";
}
else {
	echo "Database Connection success";
}


?>

the mysqli_connect according to documentation will return a object when the database connection is created, if its not then it will return false.

Set $username and $password value for the code and check if you see the below message in the screen

Database Connection success

if you see this message then we are good to proceed in to next step, if not then please check your connection variables or comment down your problem you see.

Create a form to save the question

lets alter the code a bit, we will remove our database success and error messages since we know the connection is succesful.

so our code would now change like this in index.php

<?php


$host = 'localhost';

$username = 'phpmyadmin';

$password = 'some_pass';

$database = 'forum';

$database_connection = mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database);

Lets create a simple html form for the user to input the question.

<title>Welcome to my forum | Add your question</title>
<form method="POST">
	<input type="text" placeholder="Enter your question here" name="question">
	<input type="submit" value="Create question">
</form>

<?php

$host = 'localhost';

$username = 'phpmyadmin';

$password = 'some_pass';

$database = 'forum';

$database_connection = mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database);

if you go to /forum/ you should be able to see a page like this

Now we need to add code to save the data from this input in the database.

Whenever you submit the form by clicking on Create question button, the following process happens

The browser makes a request to the index.php which is present on the server with post data which is later parsed by php in to variable named $_POST[‘question’] in the index.php, we need to save this variable to database.

Note 1: The browser sends the variable with name 'question' because the form field is defined with this name <input ... name="question"/>
Note 2: we should also note that this variable doesnt present on every page load on index.php, so we need to always check if the variable is present or not.

lets add some more code to get the variable and print it out on submit.

<title>Welcome to my forum | Add your question</title>
<form method="POST">
	<input type="text" placeholder="Enter your question here" name="question">
	<input type="submit" value="Create question">
</form>

<?php

$host = 'localhost';

$username = 'phpmyadmin';

$password = 'some_pass';

$database = 'forum';

$database_connection = mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database);

// isset and ! empty check to see if variable is not empty and is set.

if ( isset($_POST['question'] ) && !empty($_POST['question'])) {

	$question = $_POST['question'];

	echo $question; // This command prints out the variable

}

If you type the question on the input and click on create question, you should be able to see the question.

Congrats, now all we have to do this save the question to the database, to do that we need to create a mysql query and send the query to the mysql server.

// isset and ! empty check to see if variable is not empty and is set.

if ( isset($_POST['question'] ) && !empty($_POST['question'])) {

	$question = $_POST['question'];

	// This query will add the question to the mysql database, note that we are substituting
	// the $query variable in the below query.
	$query = "INSERT INTO `question` (`id`, `question`, `answer`) VALUES (NULL, '$question', '') ";

	mysqli_query($database_connection, $query);

}

Now go /forum/, Add a question, click on submit.

After you submit, Go to phpmyadmin and check the question table.

Now we have successfully completed the step of saving question to database.

Show all saved questions in the index.php

Its great that we now have ability to save the question, but we will also need the ability to see all saved question and answer, to do that we need to add additional code in index.php.

$questions_query = "SELECT * FROM `question`";
$questions_result = mysqli_query($database_connection, $questions_query);

while ( $question_data = mysqli_fetch_assoc($questions_result) ) {
	$question = $question_data['question'];
	$answer = $question_data['answer'];

	echo "<div class='single-question'>
		<b>$question</b>
		<p>$answer</p>
	</div>";
}

we would now be able to see the saved questions

We have now successfully completed the step 3, the only remaining step is allowing the user to add the answer for a question.

Allow user to add answer for a question.

we are going to use the question.php which we created before to acheive this functionality.

To do that we need to redirect the user from index.php to question.php, we are going to use the <a> element to link a question from index.php to question.php and also add a url parameter id in the index.php, so we alter the code like this in index.php.

while ( $question_data = mysqli_fetch_assoc($questions_result) ) {
	$question = $question_data['question'];
	$answer = $question_data['answer'];
		$id = $question_data['id'];

	echo "<div class='single-question'>
		<b><a href='question.php?id=$id'>$question</a></b>
		<p>$answer</p>
	</div>";

}

Now we would see the question with question link with the id param, the url should look like this.

/forum/question.php?id=4

The id parameter denotes the question id which is needed in question.php to show the question and answer, so lets add some code on question.php to show the question and a answer box.

The url param id is parsed by php and provided to us in the format $_GET[‘id’] , we are going to use the variable to show the question and answer from db. We need create a sql query to get the question and answer data for id.

To access the database we need to have our database connection code from index.php, lets copy it down to question.php

<?php

$host = 'localhost';

$username = 'phpmyadmin';

$password = 'some_pass';

$database = 'forum';

$database_connection = mysqli_connect($host, $username, $password, $database);


$id = $_GET['id']; // we get the id url parameter here.

we will write the query to get the data for id and print on the page 

$sql = "SELECT * FROM `question` WHERE id='$id'";

$question_query = mysqli_query($database_connection, $sql);

$question_data = mysqli_fetch_assoc($question_query);

$question = $question_data['question'];
$answer = $question_data['answer'];

echo "
<form method='POST'>
<div class='single-question'>
		<b>$question</b>
		<br/><br/>
		<textarea name='answer' cols='100' rows='4'>$answer</textarea>
		<br/><br/>
	</div>
	<input type='submit'  value='Update answer'/>
	</form>
";

this should render a form on the page

This form alone doesnt function, we need to add code in php side to save the data on question table, we are going to use the update query.

if you noted this

<textarea name='answer' ...>

then we would know that we need to get the $_POST[‘answer’] variable to update the answer for the question. lets add the code to save the data just like we did for question

// isset and ! empty check to see if variable is not empty and is set.

if ( isset($_POST['answer'] ) && !empty($_POST['answer'])) {

	$answer = $_POST['answer'];

	// This query will add the question to the mysql database, note that we are substituting
	// the $query variable in the below query.
	$query = "UPDATE `question` SET answer='$answer' WHERE id='$id'";

	mysqli_query($database_connection, $query);

	echo "Answer successfully updated";


}

if you update the answer you should be able to see it on index.php page

the question.php page will look like the below

once you have updated the answer it should look like this on index.php

Thats it, now we have a beautiful forum where people can add questions, all we need is some css love, lets add the css and check how it would look like.

Yay, we have finally created the forum with PHP, MYSQL and Phpmyadmin.

Download source

you can download the source code for the forum from this github

Download forum source from github

item.title: PHP ஐப் பயன்படுத்தி முதன்மை எண்ணைக் கண்டறிதல் | Find Prime number using php in tamil
item.description: PHP ஐப் பயன்படுத்தி முதன்மை எண்ணைக் கண்டறிதல் பிரதான எண் என்றால் என்ன? ஒரு பிரதான எண் (அல்லது ஒரு பிரதான) என்பது 1 ஐ விட அதிகமான இயற்கை எண், இது இரண்டு சிறிய இயற்கை எண்களின் தயாரிப்பு அல்ல. முதன்மையானதல்ல 1 ஐ விட அதிகமான இயற்கை எண் ஒரு கூட்டு எண் என்று அழைக்கப்படுகிறது. எடுத்துக்காட்டாக, 5 முதன்மையானது, ஏனெனில் 1 × 5 அல்லது 5 × 1 என ஒரு ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
PHP ஐப் பயன்படுத்தி முதன்மை எண்ணைக் கண்டறிதல்


பிரதான எண் என்றால் என்ன?

ஒரு பிரதான எண் (அல்லது ஒரு பிரதான) என்பது 1 ஐ விட அதிகமான இயற்கை எண், இது இரண்டு சிறிய இயற்கை எண்களின் தயாரிப்பு அல்ல. முதன்மையானதல்ல 1 ஐ விட அதிகமான இயற்கை எண் ஒரு கூட்டு எண் என்று அழைக்கப்படுகிறது. எடுத்துக்காட்டாக, 5 முதன்மையானது, ஏனெனில் 1 × 5 அல்லது 5 × 1 என ஒரு தயாரிப்பாக எழுதுவதற்கான ஒரே வழிகள் 5 ஐ உள்ளடக்கியது. இருப்பினும், 4 கலப்பு ஆகும், ஏனெனில் இது ஒரு தயாரிப்பு (2 × 2), இதில் இரு எண்களும் 4 ஐ விட சிறியவை. எண்கணிதத்தின் அடிப்படைக் கோட்பாட்டின் காரணமாக முதன்மைக் கோட்பாடு எண் கோட்பாட்டில் மையமாக உள்ளது: 1 ஐ விட அதிகமான ஒவ்வொரு இயற்கை எண்ணும் ஒரு பிரதம அல்லது அவற்றின் வரிசைக்கு தனித்துவமான பிரைம்களின் தயாரிப்பாக காரணியாக்கப்படலாம்.

PHP என்றால் என்ன?

PHP என்பது ஒரு பொது நோக்கம் ஸ்கிரிப்டிங் மொழி குறிப்பாக வலை அபிவிருத்திக்கு ஏற்றது.

Code:

<?php
$num = 1 ;
while ($num < 100 ) {
    $count=0;
    for ( $i=1;$i<=$num;$i++) {
        if (($num%$i)==0) {
            $count++;
        }
    }
    if ($count<3) {
    echo $num." , ";
    } $num=$num+1;
}
?>


இந்த வீடியோவில் மேலும் காண்க:

item.title: PHP operators explained
item.description: In this PHP tutorial you will learn about operators in PHP. Operators are used frequently in our PHP expressions and conditions. we have mathematical operators which are left associative For example addtion $a = 2 + 3; subtraction $b = 4 - 3; multiplication $c = 4 * 4; division $d = 10 / 5; ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
In this PHP tutorial you will learn about operators in PHP. Operators are used frequently in our PHP expressions and conditions.

we have mathematical operators which are left associative

For example addtion

$a = 2 + 3;

subtraction

$b = 4 - 3;

multiplication

$c = 4 * 4;

division

$d = 10 / 5;

Logical operators

you can find about more operators in the above video.

item.title: Utilizing Security Features in SSH
item.dc:creator: matrix-tiger
item.description: SSH lets you securely manage remote systems. However, most people don’t make use of the full set of security features SSH has to offer. This session covers SSH security topics such as encryption algorithms, using ssh-agent to forward credentials, setting up two factor authentication, and more. This Talk is Designed For DevOps engineers System administrators ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
SSH lets you securely manage remote systems. However, most people don’t make use of the full set of security features SSH has to offer. This session covers SSH security topics such as encryption algorithms, using ssh-agent to forward credentials, setting up two factor authentication, and more.

This Talk is Designed For

  • DevOps engineers
  • System administrators

Prerequisites

  • Basic knowledge of SSH, such as logging in and creating/using SSH keys

New to DigitalOcean? Get US $100 in credit when you sign up:

item.title: The Arecibo Message Decoded
item.dc:creator: matrix-tiger
item.description: The Arecibo message was humanity’s most powerful attempt at messaging aliens. Let’s decode it!. In 1974, the Arecibo radio telescope transmitted a message to contact extraterrestrials. The message was designed by Frank Drake. Here’s what it says. 00:00​ Start01:40​ Magellan TV02:35​ History of the message and M1304:35​ How the message was sent05:26​ Message Structure06:30​ Decoding ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The Arecibo message was humanity’s most powerful attempt at messaging aliens. Let’s decode it!. In 1974, the Arecibo radio telescope transmitted a message to contact extraterrestrials. The message was designed by Frank Drake. Here’s what it says.

00:00​ Start
01:40​ Magellan TV
02:35​ History of the message and M13
04:35​ How the message was sent
05:26​ Message Structure
06:30​ Decoding the first 10 numbers from binary
08:20​ Atomic elements and DNA
09:41​ Depiction of humanity and population
10:51​ Depiction of Arecibo
11:36​ Testing the message and dangers
14:00​ We’re disappearing
15:19​ Possible signal detected?

References:
Astrobiology interview with Frank Drake (2007): https://www.astrobio.net/alien-life/the-man-to-contact/
Arecibo Message Project: https://www.naic.edu/pkg/webutils/challenge/about-message.html
Encyclopedia Galactica (Write Science): https://writescience.wordpress.com/2014/02/25/cosmos-12-encyclopaedia-galactica/

item.title: This Woman’s Dog Has Saved Her Life Three Times After Detecting Her Cancer Symptoms
item.dc:creator: matrix-tiger
item.description: Hello, my name is Ben, today I will talk about my mom and out little hero Charlie. My mom Emma Smith was 42 when her dog kept sniffing her right breast. But it turned out that Charlie the dog was on to something. When I was seven my mom took me and my brother Jack, ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Hello, my name is Ben, today I will talk about my mom and out little hero Charlie. My mom Emma Smith was 42 when her dog kept sniffing her right breast. But it turned out that Charlie the dog was on to something.

When I was seven my mom took me and my brother Jack, six, to pick a puppy from a litter of Staffordshire Bull Terriers, it was love at first sight.

Right away, little Charlie came bounding over to meet us, and from that moment on she was part of the family.

She was a little bundle of energy and quite naughty, chewing everything she could get her paws on but she was so sweet and loving that no one could stay cross for long.

But when Charlie was just a few months old she began acting oddly, jumping up and sniffing at the right side of mom’s chest.

item.title: Clocking the inner workings of the human brain | Greg Gage | TEDxDetroit
item.dc:creator: matrix-tiger
item.description: The brain is complex, but extremely fascinating. We need more people interested in studying the brain because 1 in 5 people are likely to develop a neurological disorder… and there are no cures! Greg is a neuroscientist and electrical engineer who loves tinkering with all things electric. He’s developing tools, curriculum, and experiments that allow ... Read more
item.content:encoded: The brain is complex, but extremely fascinating. We need more people interested in studying the brain because 1 in 5 people are likely to develop a neurological disorder… and there are no cures! Greg is a neuroscientist and electrical engineer who loves tinkering with all things electric. He’s developing tools, curriculum, and experiments that allow the general public to participate, hands-on, in neuroscience discovery. He is a senior fellow at TED and an investigator at the National Institute of Health. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community

item.title: Appearances Elon Musk Has Made In Movies (2005 – 2018)
item.dc:creator: matrix-tiger
item.description: Elon Musk is the founder of SpaceX and Boring Company, co-founder of Neuralink and OpenAI. He is a early stage investor and current CEO of Tesla. In this video you can see Elon Musk’s appearance in the movies between 2005 and 2018

item.title: U.S. Government Now Owns $1 Billion Bitcoin
